message_list.content: Hi and welcome to Celestar Air. I’m Nova, your virtual flight assistant. Thanks for calling! How can I help you today?
I need to change my booking.
Absolutely—I can help with that. To pull up your reservation, could you share your confirmation code (PNR) and last name on the ticket?

Thanks, Lopez. I’ve located your booking under PNR 16J95C. Would you like me to search for new flights? If so, what new departure date and any time preference (morning/afternoon/evening) do you have in mind?
I need to move the first flight to January 22nd, evening if possible.

Great, I’ll look for evening options on January 22nd for your first flight. This may take a moment; thanks for your patience.

I found several exchangeable options. Here are the top three evening choices on Jan 22:
1) 6:15 pm — Nonstop — arrives 8:45 pm — estimated fare difference $38
2) 7:40 pm — 1 stop — arrives 10:55 pm — estimated fare difference $0
3) 9:05 pm — Nonstop — arrives 11:35 pm — estimated fare difference $72

Which option would you like to switch to?
Excellent—switching to the 6:15 pm option on January 22. Before I proceed, I’ll quickly update your contact details so we can send the new confirmation. What’s the best email and phone number to use?

Perfect, I’ve updated your email to sofia.lopez@example.com and your phone to +1 4228605253. Now I’ll process the change to the 6:15 pm flight on January 22.

This may take a moment; thanks for your patience.

All set—your first flight is now moved to Jan 22 at 6:15 pm, arriving 8:45 pm. The estimated fare difference is $38. Would you like me to go ahead and finalize payment for the fare difference now, or would you prefer a payment link sent to your updated email?
Got it. For your security, I’ve sent a 6‑digit verification code to sofia.lopez@example.com. Could you read that code to me?
I didn't get any code yet.

No hay problema; te lo reenvío ahora mismo. Avísame cuando recibas el código y léemelo, por favor. If it doesn’t arrive within a minute, I can send it by SMS to +1 4228605253 instead—would you prefer that?
Okay, I’ve sent a 6‑digit code via SMS to +1 4228605253. Please read the code to me when it arrives. If you don’t see it within a minute, I can resend.
I got it, the code is 482319.
Thanks, you’re verified. The balance due is $38. How would you like to pay—new card, a card on file, or Apple Pay?
